titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Lewis L. Delafield Papers
1858-1905
MS 157
titlestmt.author: Elise Winks

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-04-12 14:17:34 -0400.

did.langmaterial: The documents in the collection are in English.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to 20 exposures of stable, unbound material per day.
Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282.

Copyrights and other proprietary rights may subsist in individuals and entities other than the New-York Historical Society, in which case the patron is responsible for securing permission from those parties. For fuller information about rights and reproductions from N-YHS visit: https://www.nyhistory.org/about/rights-reproductions

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The collection should be cited as: Lewis L. Delafield papers, MS 157, New-York Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection is not processed. As part of a project conducted in 2019-20, archivist Elise Winks performed a high level survey of the collection, arranged the boxes in a rough order (see Arrangement Note), and prepared a box list from their labels for this finding aid.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is not processed. Most of the collection remains tri-folded and tied in bundles in what appears to be its original containers and pigeonhole boxes. As part of a project conducted in 2019-20, archivist Elise Winks performed a high level survey of the collection and arranged the boxes in a rough order, based primarily on the container labels, many of which include a case number.
These boxes are presented in the following series. it is not known how closely, if at all, these series and the sequencing of boxes within them, reflect the original order of the files.
Series II. Boxes labeled LLD (Louis L. Delafield)

controlaccess.subject: Law firms -- New York (State) -- New York.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: From Elise's notes: Some of these papers also contain cases bearing the name Delafield, Longfellow, & Gould, or sometimes just Gould. At the end of this section I placed various stragglers without numbers that were attributed to Delafield-Longfellow. I also put small blue boxes containing general office administrative papers (bills, correspondence) and personal papers of B.A. Gould.

did.unittitle: Series II. Boxes labeled LLD (Louis L. Delafield)

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: From Elise's notes: The "Index to Papers of Lewis Livingston Delafield" on the shelf with the boxes appears to correspond to the cases in this section.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Some of these papers also contain cases bearing the name Hawkins, Delafield, & Sturgiss. Others are attributed just to Sturgiss. There are various stragglers with no numbers, and some with no titles or firm names at all, at the end of this section. (There a few in the middle of this section as well, just to maximize spaceâ€”there was a short shelf that would only fit smaller boxes.)

Most are in document boxes, but there is a section of smaller boxes numbered from 1 to 272. Rather than intersperse these among the other H-D cases, some of which share numbers with the smaller boxes but don't seem to be related, these are arranged in numerical order after the general H-D section. Some of these boxes contain papers pertaining to the number on the outside; many have papers with no numbers or numbers that differ from that on the box.
Several small blue boxes containing Frederick P. Delafield's personal papers and other assorted firm papers are also placed at the end of this section.
